meanings.definition: A board lowered over the side of a boat to reduce sideways drift.
meanings.sent1: The sailor attached the leeboard to the boat to help it stay on course.
meanings.sent2: The leeboard was essential for keeping the small boat from veering off course.
meanings.sent3: When the mischievous seagull landed on the leeboard, the boat started spinning in circles.
meanings.sent4: The leeboard acted like a stabilizing wing, keeping the boat steady in the choppy waters.
meanings.sent5: With the leeboard in place, the boat glided smoothly through the water without drifting.

meanings.definition: A board used to provide lateral resistance to a boat.
meanings.sent1: The old wooden leeboard helped the boat resist the sideways force of the wind.
meanings.sent2: Sailors relied on the leeboard to prevent the boat from sliding sideways.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous crab tried to climb the leeboard, thinking it was a ladder to the sky.
meanings.sent4: The leeboard was like a steadfast friend, always there to keep the boat from straying off course.
meanings.sent5: As the storm raged, the leeboard stood firm, pushing against the lateral pressure with ease.
